instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Resistors on the circuit check out, bad mcp/smc?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Basics first. <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> present? Resistance to GND on 3V42?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is present
resistance to gnd on 3v42 is 2.790kohm

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: 2.8K is way too low, dead MCP most likely.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Measured again i get 110kohm sometimes 4mohm it fluctuates a known good does the same as well.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Shorted power pads on the board to turn it on? Does <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>  toggle when pressing power button?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Shorting power pads does nothing.
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRTBN_L</SIGNAL> toggles when pressing power button.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: History, liquid? Check all rails for shorts?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
board does seem to have had some water damage
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> = 1ohm resistance
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> = .19mohm resistance
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = .005mohm resistance
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_S5</SIGNAL> = 313.03 ohm resistance
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_FW</SIGNAL> = 15kohm and rising
<SIGNAL>PPVP_FW</SIGNAL> = 6.45mohm resistance
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_FW</SIGNAL> = 279ohm resistance

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> = 1ohm resistance
I would call that a possible short. Make sure board is fully discharged and check again. Inject voltage if still shorted and check current.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C4690</CAPACITOR> was shorting replaced and board works. Thanks for the help!
